heaviest_rainfall.status: 36.8mm of rain was recorded as having fallen on 04 January 2025, marking an exceptional 37.2 hour precipitation event.  At times the rain was falling at 4.6mm per hour.

heaviest_rainrate.status: On 02 September 2025, the rain fell at an exceptional rate, peaking at 27.0mm per hour, the heaviest downpour recorded.  A total of 21.19mm fell over the 15.0 hour storm.

longest_rain.status: On 04 January 2025, the rain lasted for 37.2 hours, which is the longest time recorded by our database.  36.8mm accumulated and it fell at 4.6mm per hour at times.

most_lightning.status: The lightning strike count peaked at 23 on 07 September 2025, the highest since recording started on 11 April 2025.

nearest_lightning.status: When lightning struck on 13 May 2025, its position was recorded at just 4.97 miles away, the closest on record.

storm.status: Stormy conditions are expected.  This is the first storm in the region since 10 September 2025.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: Currently, the weather is stable with no cold snap in progress.  So far, 6 cold snaps have been recorded this year.  The average yearly count is 3.7.

extreme.status: The maximum temperature difference seen is 26.7°C, observed on 29 April 2025 when the temperature fell to 0.4°C but also managed to reach 27.1°C on the same day.

heatwaves.status: At the moment, it is not a heatwaves.  This year has seen 6 heatwavess; typically, 1.9 heatwavess happen every year.

tropical.status: The last tropical night was on 18 July 2025 and it has only happened 62 times since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (188°).  In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: The largest wind gust ever was on 13 October 2012 with a value of 93.7 mph.

run.status: The highest wind run ever seen is 1754 miles on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: The record wind speed remains at 93.7 mph from 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, cooler for the feels like temperature (down 2.5°C) and drier conditions in outside humidity (down 8%) and rainfall (down 0.4 mm).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in rainfall (up 0.4 mm).

The past week and month had observable variation in rainfall (up 0.1 mm) and cloud levels (up 598 m) when compared to today.

Today’s average cloud levels is 565.2m higher than yesterday, 261.5m lower than the past week, 598.5m lower than the past month.

Yesterday, cloud levels hit a low of 840m and a high of 1760m, averaging 1718.3m; the past week and month reported somewhat higher averages.

summary.summary: Inside; temperature should feel pleasantly mild. Outside; mild temperatures are expected. Also, air moisture should feel ok and calm and still conditions are expected. Possible light showers, clouds will be high, allowing good sunlight, and sunlight will be very intense and bright. Weather could become unsettled.
